Wisdom has been cast as the highest level in a hierarchy consisting of data, information, knowledge and wisdom ([[DIKW]]). As the fourth stage in this distillation process, wisdom is a specific grouping of scientific-knowledge, known as ''scientific wisdom''. [[Jonas Salk]], famous for discovering the poliomyelitis vaccine, views scientific wisdom as consisting of 5 components:
  −
* Personal Passion for Scientific Interest Area
  −
* Skills-Competence in Scientific Interest Area
  −
* Purpose in Scientific Skills-Execution
  −
* Ability To Sponsor Hi-Value Collective Mastery Experiences In Science
  −
* Talent in Seeking Solutions That Satisfy Man AND Do Not Violate The Laws of Nature.
      −
References: Jonas Salk: “Survival Of The Wisest”

==The Scientific Perspective On ‘Wisdom’==
  +   +
Scientifically, '''‘wisdom’''' is a specific stage along the scientific learning pathway, using the scientific method.
  +   +
Scientifically, '''‘learning’''' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Learning]is defined as ‘changing the meaning of life experience’.
  +   +
'''‘Scientific-learning’''' is defined as ‘changing the meaning of life experience through the appropriate use of the scientific method’.
  +   +
'''The ‘scientific method’''' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_scientific_method]is one of many different ways of learning about the universe around us (and the universe inside of each of us) and contains the following basic steps:
  +
1. Questions
  +
2. Hypotheses
  +
3. Predictions
  +
4. Design Of Controlled Scientific Experiments
  +
5. Collecting Experimental Results
  +
6. Proper Interpretation of Experimental Evidence
  +
7. Sharing Results & Methods Truthfully With Others
  +
8. Checking For Reproducibility By Others
  +
9. Asking New Questions
  +   +
'''‘Wisdom’''' is currently viewed as the fourth stage in a DIKW [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DIKW]-based approach to the scientific-learning process.
  +
1. The first stage starts with the infinite facts of the universe around us (and the universe inside of each of us): Fortunately, '''''most data-facts are functionally silent'''''. This stage is termed '''‘Scientific-'''Data’''''''.
  +
2. The second stage is a specific grouping of data that is termed '''‘Scientific-Information’'''. 'Scientific-Information' simply '''''places a demand on the attention of the observer'''''. (Some experts define ‘scientific-information’ as ‘scientific-data in context’).
  +
3. The third stage is a specific grouping of information that is termed '''‘Scientific-Knowledge’'''. The acquisition of 'Scientific-Knowledge' '''''allows the observer to predict specific responses'''''.(Some experts define ‘scientific-knowledge’ as ‘scientific-information in context’).
  +
4. The fourth stage in this distillation process is a specific grouping of scientific-knowledge, known as '''‘Scientific-Wisdom’'''. The exact definition of ‘Scientific-Wisdom’ is somewhat difficult to describe concisely: Certainly, whereas ‘scientific-wisdom’ could be viewed as ‘scientific-knowledge in context’, this definition does not convey the precise operational sense of the term.
  +   +
Perhaps '''Jonas Salk''' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonas_Salk], the pioneering 20th Century scientist who is credited for discovering the first cure for poliomyelitis, has performed the most elegant recent studies of ‘Scientific-Wisdom’. In brief, Salk (and now many others) believe that '''‘Scientific-Wisdom’''' '''''possesses 5 basic characteristics''''':
  +
1. Personal '''Passion''' for Scientific Interest Area
  +
2. Skills-'''Competence''' in Scientific Interest Area
  +
3. '''Purpose''' in Scientific Skills-Execution
  +
4. Ability To Sponsor '''Hi-Value Collective Mastery''' Experiences In Science
  +
5. Talent in '''Seeking Solutions That Satisfy Man AND Also Do Not Violate The Laws of Nature'''.
  +   +   +
It would certainly be impossible to properly conduct modern 21st Century scientific operations without a clear understanding of
  +
• '''‘Scientific-Data’''',
  +
• '''‘Scientific-Information’''', and
  +
• '''‘Scientific-Knowledge’'''.
  +
  +
At the same time, it is becoming increasingly clear, in our increasingly-interconnected science and technology-oriented planet, that '''‘Scientific-Wisdom’''' is the next logical and required step in the DIKW-based scientific learning pathway: Moreover, ‘Scientific-Wisdom’ is becoming increasingly recognized as representing a refined level of scientific understanding.
  +   +   +
